summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Clyde Washington by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding his appearance and production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is dated August 15, 2019, and requires appearance on August 20, 2019, indicating an active investigation into Epstein-related matters at that time.

persons.name: Clyde Washington
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before the grand jury and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Washington is subpoenaed to produce all materials relating to Epstein, indicating he is a person of interest in the investigation into Epstein.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued the subpoena commanding Washington's appearance before the grand jury.

events.title: Grand jury appearance of Clyde Washington
events.description: Clyde Washington is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal law.

events.title: Issuance of grand jury subpoena
events.description: The subpoena is issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Clyde Washington.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Clyde Washington on August 15, 2019, requiring his appearance on August 20, 2019.
The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including text messages, emails, social media messages, documents, and notes.
The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records).
The subpoena indicates the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, led by Geoffrey S. Berman, was actively investigating Epstein-related matters in August 2019.
The subpoena's broad scope covers electronically stored material on computers, email accounts, iCloud accounts, servers, cellphones, and other devices, whether in the U.S. or abroad.
